content and ready it for delivery becomes the most interesting thing for you to transform when you look at the
cloud and so this piece in the middle where you're going to look at okay if I'm creating content do I need to push
it to a mobile device a smart TV is it going to go to an iPad is it going to go
to cable or satellite or am i selling it as a transaction based asset really the
supply chain should be agnostic to that process ultimately you have content you create it you will then package it for
the right formats in the way that you're going to distribute it based on your monetization choice and so one of the
big trends that we see from our customers is trying to figure out the complexity of that distribution as the
world changes and as cable satellite OTT direct-to-consumer become models that
you have to consider in the way that you sell even if you sell your content to other providers you still have to
package it for them and so this agile supply chain becomes a very important engine that we see being built on top of
content lakes and data lakes and serverless technologies and AI MML and
what we see then is this feedback loop which is if you decide if you're investing in contents and you have to make content storing that content in
production is very expensive it's also very costly to move around so the rise of virtual desktops and studios in the

a supply chain which allows you to dynamically package that for distribution and then the important
thing is being able to instrument and measure all of the performance metrics all of the quality how people are

render man as their pipeline manager they were using Autodesk and foundry as

production was the FIFA World Cup by Fox Sports and so they so Foxsports had the

which is they decided to keep all the redditors in LA and they estimated that
the cost of keeping their editors and I would save them $100,000 per editor so there was a huge cost savings by not

Center which is receiving the camera feeds we're going from SDI to IP Fox you
